questions.question: Worker A finishes a job in 6 hours. Worker B finishes it in 3 hours. Working together, how long?
questions.hint: Add their rates: 1/6 + 1/3 = ? Then find the time from combined rate.

questions.question: Two cars 300 km apart drive toward each other. Car A at 70 km/h, Car B at 80 km/h. How far from A's start do they meet?
questions.hint: Time to meet = 300 ÷ 150 = 2 hours. A travels 70 × 2.

questions.question: A tank has inlet A (fills in 4h), inlet B (fills in 6h), and drain C (empties in 8h). All open, how long to fill?
questions.hint: Net rate = 1/4 + 1/6 - 1/8. Find common denominator.

questions.question: 6 workers finish in 8 hours. After 2 hours, 2 workers leave. How much longer to finish?
questions.hint: Calculate work done in 2 hours, then remaining work with 4 workers.

questions.question: A boat travels 20 km upstream in 5 hours and 20 km downstream in 2 hours. What's the current speed?
questions.hint: Upstream speed = 4 km/h, downstream = 10 km/h. Current = (10-4) ÷ 2.

questions.question: A and B together take 12 hours. A alone takes 20 hours. How long for B alone?
questions.hint: 1/12 = 1/20 + 1/B. Solve for B.

questions.question: A train 150m long overtakes a man walking at 6 km/h in 15 seconds. What's the train's speed?
questions.hint: Relative speed = 150m ÷ 15s = 10 m/s = 36 km/h. Train = 36 + 6.

questions.question: Pipe A fills in 4 hours, Pipe B in 12 hours. A runs for 2 hours, then B joins. Total time?
questions.hint: A does 1/2 in 2 hours. Remaining 1/2 by both together takes...

questions.question: A car goes 120 km at 40 km/h, then 120 km at 60 km/h. What's the average speed?
questions.hint: Total distance = 240 km. Total time = 3 + 2 = 5 hours. Average = 240 ÷ 5.

questions.question: Worker A is twice as fast as B. Together they finish in 4 hours. How long for A alone?
questions.hint: If A's rate is 2x, B's rate is x. Together: 3x. Set up the equation.

questions.question: Two trains 200 km apart travel toward each other. One at 60 km/h leaves 30 min before the other at 80 km/h. When do they meet?
questions.hint: After 30 min, gap = 170 km. Combined speed = 140 km/h. Time = 170 ÷ 140.

questions.question: A cistern fills in 9 hours. A leak empties it in 18 hours. How long to fill with leak?
questions.hint: Net rate = 1/9 - 1/18. Find common denominator.

questions.question: 10 men finish work in 18 days. After 6 days, 5 men leave. How many more days?
questions.hint: Work done in 6 days by 10 men. Remaining work done by 5 men.

questions.question: A plane flies 600 km with wind in 2 hours. Against same wind, it takes 3 hours. What's the plane's speed in still air?
questions.hint: With wind: 300 km/h. Against: 200 km/h. Plane = (300 + 200) ÷ 2.

questions.question: 8 workers finish 3/4 of a job in 6 hours. How many workers to finish the rest in 2 hours?
questions.hint: Find rate from first part, then calculate workers for remaining 1/4.

questions.question: Two pipes together fill in 6 hours. One pipe alone takes 5 hours more than the other. Find the faster pipe's time.
questions.hint: Let faster = x hours. Slower = x+5. Set up: 1/x + 1/(x+5) = 1/6.

questions.question: A train 300m long passes a bridge 200m long in 25 seconds. What's the train's speed in km/h?
questions.hint: Total distance = 500m. Speed = 500 ÷ 25 = 20 m/s = 72 km/h.

questions.question: A can do 1/3 of work in 5 days. B joins and they finish the rest in 3 days. B alone would take?
questions.hint: A's rate = 1/15 per day. Together they do 2/3 in 3 days. Find B's rate.

questions.question: Car A at 60 km/h leaves at 8 AM. Car B at 80 km/h leaves at 9 AM same direction. When does B catch A?
questions.hint: A's head start = 60 km. B gains 20 km/h. Catch-up time = 3 hours after 9 AM.

questions.question: A pool has two inlets (fill in 3h and 4h) and one outlet (empty in 6h). Starting empty, all open, how long to fill?
questions.hint: Net rate = 1/3 + 1/4 - 1/6. Find common denominator.

questions.question: A's efficiency is 150% of B's. B's efficiency is 80% of C's. If C takes 30 hours alone, how long for all 3?
questions.hint: Express A and B rates in terms of C's rate. Then add all three.

questions.question: A man rows 15 km upstream in 3 hours and 15 km downstream in 1.5 hours. His speed in still water?
questions.hint: Upstream = 5 km/h, downstream = 10 km/h. Man's speed = (5 + 10) ÷ 2.

questions.question: 12 workers working 6 hours/day finish in 10 days. How many days for 15 workers at 8 hours/day?
questions.hint: Total work = 12 × 6 × 10 = 720 worker-hours. Divide by (15 × 8).

questions.question: A, B, C together take 4 hours. A alone takes 12 hours, B alone 8 hours. C alone?
A train passes a pole in 10 seconds and a 150m platform in 25 seconds. Find the train's length.
questions.hint: Speed = length ÷ 10. Also speed = (length + 150) ÷ 25. Solve.

questions.question: Tap A fills in 20 hours. Tap B fills in 30 hours. Both run for 4 hours, then only B runs. Total time?
questions.hint: In 4 hours: 4/20 + 4/30 = 1/3. B fills remaining 2/3 at 1/30 per hour.

questions.question: Two cars start from same point at same time. One north at 40 km/h, one east at 30 km/h. When are they 100 km apart?
questions.hint: Distance² = (40t)² + (30t)² = 100². Solve for t.

questions.question: A types at 60 words/min, B at 40 words/min. They type 5000 words. A leaves after 30 min. Total time?
questions.hint: In 30 min, both type 3000 words. B types remaining 2000 alone.

questions.question: A tank has capacity 1000 liters. Inlet at 50 L/min, outlet at 30 L/min. Starting with 200 L, how long to fill?
questions.hint: Net rate = 20 L/min. Need 800 L more. Time = 800 ÷ 20.

questions.question: 5 men and 3 women finish in 4 days. 3 men and 5 women finish in 5 days. How long for 2 men and 2 women?
questions.hint: Set up two equations with man-days and woman-days. Solve the system.

questions.question: A train 100m long traveling at 60 km/h passes another train 150m long going same direction at 40 km/h. Time to pass?
questions.hint: Relative speed = 20 km/h = 50/9 m/s. Distance = 250m. Time = 250 ÷ (50/9).

questions.question: A completes 3/5 of work, B completes 1/4, C does the rest. If C takes 3 hours for his part, how long for all 3 together?
questions.hint: C does 3/20 of work in 3 hours. Find all rates and combine.

questions.question: A motorcyclist travels 120 km. First half at 40 km/h, second half at 60 km/h. Average speed?
Pipe A fills in 12 hours. After half filled, pipe B (fills in 18 hours) joins. How much longer?
questions.hint: A takes 6 hours for half. Both together fill remaining half.

questions.question: A and B complete 3/5 of work in 6 days. B finishes the rest in 8 days. A alone would take?
questions.hint: From B's solo work, find B's rate. Then find A's rate from combined work.

questions.question: Two trains 500 km apart travel toward each other. One leaves 1 hour earlier at 50 km/h, other at 75 km/h. Distance from slower's start when they meet?
questions.hint: After 1 hour, gap = 450 km. Meeting time from second train's start = 450 ÷ 125.

questions.question: A machine breaks down 1/4 of the time. With B (no breakdowns), a job takes 8 hours. A alone takes 18 hours effective. B alone?
questions.hint: A's effective rate is 3/4 × 1/18. Set up equation with combined rate = 1/8.

questions.question: Inlet A fills in 10 hours, B in 15 hours, outlet C empties in 6 hours. All open, what happens?
7 boys and 5 girls finish in 4 hours. 3 boys and 7 girls finish in 6 hours. How long for 1 boy and 1 girl?
questions.hint: Set up two equations. Solve for boy-rate and girl-rate.

questions.question: A boat's speed in still water is 12 km/h. It takes same time to go 16 km upstream as 24 km downstream. Current speed?
questions.hint: 16/(12-c) = 24/(12+c). Cross multiply and solve for c.
